title: Graph DFS Traversal (Adjacency List)
prompt:
Given a graph as an adjacency list and a starting vertex, return the values visited by a depth-first search (recursive).

Traversal rules:
- Visit neighbors in the order they appear in the adjacency list.
- Do not visit a vertex more than once.

Return an array of visited vertices in order.
constraintQuestions: Is the graph undirected or directed? (Undirected in examples.)
Should we start from the given vertex? (Yes.)
Should we visit neighbors in adjacency list order? (Yes.)
Do we need to avoid revisiting vertices? (Yes.)
Is the graph always connected? (No, visit only reachable nodes.)

walkthrough.title: Recursive DFS
walkthrough.body: Use recursion to visit a node, mark it visited, then recursively visit each unvisited neighbor in order.

walkthrough.title: JavaScript (DFS implementation)
Complexity
walkthrough.body:
Time: O(V + E) for vertices and edges.
Space: O(V) for recursion stack and visited set.
